verses.verse: When you sit <S%H3427><s%> to eat <S%H3898><s%> with a ruler, <S%H4910><s%> consider <S%H995><s%> diligently <S%H995><s%> what is before you; <S%H6440><s%>
put <S%H7760><s%> a knife <S%H7915><s%> to your throat, <S%H3930><s%> if you are a man given <S%H1167><s%> to appetite. <S%H5315><s%>
Don't <S%H183><s%> be desirous of his dainties, <S%H4303><s%> since they are deceitful <S%H3577><s%> food. <S%H3899><s%>
Don't <S%H3021><s%> weary yourself to be rich. <S%H6238><s%> In your wisdom, <S%H998><s%> show restraint. <S%H2308><s%>

Why do you set <S%H5774><s%> your eyes <S%H5869><s%> on that which is not? <S%H6213><s%> For it certainly sprouts <S%H6213><s%> wings <S%H3671><s%> like an eagle <S%H5404><s%> and flies <S%H5774><s%> in the sky. <S%H8064><s%>
Don't <S%H3898><s%> eat the food <S%H3899><s%> of him who has a stingy <S%H7451><s%> eye, <S%H5869><s%> and don't <S%H183><s%> crave his delicacies: <S%H4303><s%>
for as he thinks <S%H8176><s%> about <S%H5315><s%> the cost, <S%H398><s%> so he is. "Eat and drink! <S%H8354><s%>" he says <S%H559><s%> to you, <S%H3820><s%> but his heart is not with you.
The morsel <S%H6595><s%> which you have eaten <S%H398><s%> you shall vomit up, <S%H6958><s%> and lose <S%H7843><s%> your good <S%H5273><s%> words. <S%H1697><s%>
Don't <S%H1696><s%> speak in the ears <S%H241><s%> of a fool, <S%H3684><s%> for he will despise <S%H936><s%> the wisdom <S%H7922><s%> of your words. <S%H4405><s%>
Don't <S%H5253><s%> move the ancient <S%H5769><s%> boundary stone. <S%H1366><s%> Don't <S%H935><s%> encroach on the fields <S%H7704><s%> of the fatherless: <S%H3490><s%>
for their Defender <S%H1350><s%> is strong. <S%H2389><s%> He will plead <S%H7378><s%> their case against you. <S%H7379><s%>
Apply <S%H935><s%> your heart <S%H3820><s%> to instruction, <S%H4148><s%> and your ears <S%H241><s%> to the words <S%H561><s%> of knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
Don't <S%H4513><s%> withhold correction <S%H4148><s%> from a child. <S%H5288><s%> If you punish <S%H5221><s%> him with the rod, <S%H7626><s%> he will not die. <S%H4191><s%>
Punish <S%H5221><s%> him with the rod, <S%H7626><s%> and save <S%H5337><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from Sheol. <S%H7585><s%>
My son, <S%H1121><s%> if your heart <S%H3820><s%> is wise, <S%H2449><s%> then my heart <S%H3820><s%> will be glad, <S%H8055><s%> even mine: <S%H589><s%>
yes, <S%H3629><s%> my heart will rejoice, <S%H5937><s%> when your lips <S%H8193><s%> speak <S%H1696><s%> what is right. <S%H4339><s%>
Don't <S%H3820><s%> let your heart envy <S%H7065><s%> sinners; <S%H2400><s%> but rather fear <S%H3374><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> all the day long. <S%H3117><s%>
Indeed surely there is <S%H3426><s%> a future <S%H319><s%> hope, <S%H8615><s%> and your hope will not be cut off. <S%H3772><s%>
Listen, <S%H8085><s%> my son, <S%H1121><s%> and be wise, <S%H2449><s%> and keep <S%H833><s%> your heart <S%H3820><s%> on the right path! <S%H1870><s%>
Don't <S%H3196><s%> be among ones drinking too much wine, <S%H2151><s%> or those who gorge themselves on meat: <S%H1320><s%>
for the drunkard <S%H5433><s%> and the glutton <S%H2151><s%> shall become poor; <S%H3423><s%> and drowsiness <S%H5124><s%> clothes <S%H3847><s%> them in rags. <S%H7168><s%>
Listen <S%H8085><s%> to your father <S%H1><s%> who gave you life, <S%H3205><s%> and don't <S%H936><s%> despise your mother <S%H517><s%> when she is old. <S%H2204><s%>
Buy <S%H7069><s%> the truth, <S%H571><s%> and don't <S%H4376><s%> sell it. <S%H2451><s%> Get wisdom, discipline, <S%H4148><s%> and understanding. <S%H998><s%>
The father <S%H1><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> has great <S%H1524><s%> joy. <S%H1523><s%> Whoever fathers <S%H3205><s%> a wise <S%H2450><s%> child delights in him. <S%H8055><s%>
Let your father <S%H1><s%> and your mother <S%H517><s%> be glad! <S%H8055><s%> Let her who bore <S%H3205><s%> you rejoice! <S%H1523><s%>
My son, <S%H1121><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> me your heart; <S%H3820><s%> and let your eyes <S%H5869><s%> keep <S%H7521><s%> in my ways. <S%H1870><s%>
For a prostitute <S%H2181><s%> is a deep <S%H6013><s%> pit; <S%H7745><s%> and a wayward wife <S%H5237><s%> is a narrow <S%H6862><s%> well. <S%H875><s%>
Yes, <S%H693><s%> she lies in wait like a robber, <S%H2863><s%> and increases <S%H3254><s%> the unfaithful <S%H898><s%> among men. <S%H120><s%>

Who has woe? <S%H188><s%> Who has sorrow? <S%H17><s%> Who has strife? <S%H4079><s%> Who has complaints? <S%H7879><s%> Who has needless <S%H2600><s%> bruises? <S%H6482><s%> Who has bloodshot <S%H2448><s%> eyes? <S%H5869><s%>
Those who stay long <S%H309><s%> at the wine; <S%H3196><s%> those who go <S%H935><s%> to seek <S%H2713><s%> out mixed wine. <S%H4469><s%>

Don't <S%H7200><s%> look at the wine <S%H3196><s%> when it is red, <S%H119><s%> when it <S%H5414><s%> sparkles <S%H5869><s%> in the cup, <S%H3563><s%> when it goes <S%H1980><s%> down smoothly. <S%H4339><s%>
In the end, <S%H319><s%> it bites <S%H5391><s%> like a snake, <S%H5175><s%> and poisons <S%H6567><s%> like a viper. <S%H6848><s%>
Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> will see <S%H7200><s%> strange things, <S%H2114><s%> and your mind <S%H3820><s%> will imagine <S%H1696><s%> confusing things. <S%H8419><s%>
Yes, <S%H7901><s%> you will be as he who lies down in the midst <S%H3820><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> or as he who lies <S%H7901><s%> on top <S%H7218><s%> of the rigging: <S%H2260><s%>

"They hit <S%H5221><s%> me, <S%H2470><s%> and I was not hurt! They beat <S%H1986><s%> me, <S%H3045><s%> and I don't feel it! <S%H6974><s%> When will I wake up? <S%H1245><s%> I can do it again. I can find another. <S%H3254><s%>"
